definition: to reside/to be (in a certain position)/to store up/to be at a standstill/residence/house/restaurant/classifier for bedrooms
(archaic) sentence-final particle expressing a doubting attitude

sentences.english: After that, people call on their relatives, friends and neighbors.
sentences.chinese: 在那之后，人们给亲戚，朋友和邻居拜年。

sentences.english: A neighbor gave me a box of zucchinis and cucumbers.
sentences.chinese: 邻居给我一箱义大利菜瓜与黄瓜。

sentences.english: One of the Murphys' neighbors also noticed 'unusual' traits.
sentences.chinese: 墨菲夫妇的一个邻居也注意到他们与众不同的特点。

sentences.english: Love the neighbor. But don't get caught.
sentences.chinese: 爱你的邻居，不过不要被抓包。

sentences.english: My employer told me not to speak to the neighbors.
sentences.chinese: 我的雇主告诉我不可跟邻居交谈。

sentences.english: The first man's neighbours were unhelpful.
sentences.chinese: 第一个男人的邻居不乐于助人。

sentences.english: It was my neighbor’s wife! I rushed in without hesitation.
sentences.chinese: 原来是我邻居的妻子在叫唤，我毫不犹豫的冲了过去。

sentences.english: To his surprise, the new neighbor is his primary school.
sentences.chinese: 令他惊讶的是，这个新邻居竟然是他的小学同学。

sentences.english: I congratulate my neighbor, whose son has just won the election.
sentences.chinese: 我祝贺我的邻居，他的儿子刚刚赢得选举。

sentences.english: She complained to the police about the barking of her neighbour's dog.
sentences.chinese: 她向警方抱怨邻居家的狗叫声。

sentences.english: You thanked her by throwing it through the next-door-neighbor's window.
sentences.chinese: 你报答她，把邻居的玻璃砸得稀里哗啦。

sentences.english: Max enlisted the help of his neighbors to find his missing dog.
sentences.chinese: 麦斯寻求邻居协助他寻找失踪的狗儿。

sentences.english: At the time Xinhui and I were neighbours, living in adjacent yards.
sentences.chinese: 当时我和新辉是邻居，前后院住。

sentences.english: A frog and a squirrel were neighbors.
sentences.chinese: 一只青蛙和一只松鼠是邻居。

sentences.english: The neighbor often borrowed my inflator.
sentences.chinese: 邻居经常借我家的打气筒。

sentences.english: She peered at the neighbors from behind the curtain.
sentences.chinese: 她从帘子后面凝视着邻居们。

definition: neighbors/next-door neighbors/related work units/colleagues doing related work
a relative (i.e. family relation)/CL:門|门[men2],個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
(informal) grandma (paternal grandmother)/(respectful) mistress of the house/CL:位[wei4]/(coll.) boobies/breasts
daughter-in-law/wife (of a younger man)/young married woman/young woman
